diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Familial Bilateral Osteochondritis Dissecans of the Femoral Head
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease, hereditary dysplasias (multiple epiphyseal dysplasia, dysplasia epiphysealis capitis femoris, bilateral hereditary microepiphyseal dysplasia of the hip)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The presented cases clearly demonstrate bilateral idiopathic osteochondritis dissecans of the femoral head in various family members. No prior or subsequent changes consistent with Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease were found. The patients showed no involvement of other joints and were of normal stature, which eliminates the likelihood of multiple epiphyseal dysplasia.
